title: Work - work done by gravity and normal force

content.description: A block is pushed up an incline with a rough surface at a constant speed <math alttext="v" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>v</mi> </math> with a constant force <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>F</mi></math> which is parallel to the incline, as shown in the figure. The coefficient of kinetic friction between the block and the incline is <math alttext="mu sub k" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <msub> <mi>Î¼</mi> <mi>k</mi> </msub> </math>.
content.question:
Which of the following correctly describes the work <math alttext="W sub g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>W</mi><mi>g</mi></msub></mstyle></math> done by the gravitational force and the work <math alttext="W sub N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>W</mi><mtext>N</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> done by the normal force on the system consisting of only the block as the block moves up the incline?
<math alttext="W sub g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>W</mi><mi>g</mi></msub></mstyle></math><math alttext="W sub N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>W</mi><mtext>N</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>ANegativeZeroBNegativeNegativeCZeroZeroDZeroNegative

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
